meanings.definition: A person or thing used to lure or entice someone or something into a trap or danger.
meanings.sent1: The hunter placed a decoy duck in the pond to attract real ducks.
meanings.sent2: The decoy owl scared away the smaller birds from the garden.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox used a decoy rabbit to trick the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a decoy, hiding the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The shiny object acted as a decoy, distracting the curious cat.

meanings.definition: To lure or entice (someone or something) into a trap or danger.
meanings.sent1: The spy tried to decoy the enemy troops away from the secret base.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman used a shiny lure to decoy the fish towards his boat.
meanings.sent3: The magician decoyed the audience's attention to his left hand while performing a trick with his right.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter decoyed him into thinking everything was fine.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread decoyed customers into the bakery.
